results.adx_keywords: Super Bowl;Football;National Anthems;Kelce, Travis;Sirianni, Nick;National Football League;Kansas City Chiefs;Philadelphia Eagles
results.title: 10 Things You Might Have Missed During the Super Bowl
results.abstract: A coach wept. A tennis star hawked cognac and beer. Nobody tried to sell you cryptocurrency. Rihanna dropped in to sing and lived to tell about it. And Kansas City won a football game.

media.caption: Rihanna performed without any featured acts, though she had a few friends helping her out.
media.copyright: AJ Mast for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections;United States Politics and Government;State of the Union Message (US);Polls and Public Opinion;International Relations;United States Economy;Federal Budget (US);Holocaust and the Nazi Era;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Fetterman, John (1969- );Perel, Solomon
results.byline: By Gail Collins and Bret Stephens
results.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Didn’t Like What She Saw
results.abstract: Biden may be 80, but the real danger is the prepubescent opposition.

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Pilots;Air Line Pilots Assn;Federal Aviation Administration;National Transportation Safety Board;United Airlines;Maui (Hawaii);Pacific Ocean;San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: United Flight From Maui Came Within 800 Feet of Striking Pacific Ocean
results.abstract: The plane, a Boeing 777-200, climbed to 2,200 feet on Dec. 18 before entering a steep dive and falling at a rate of nearly 8,600 feet per minute, according to flight data.

media.caption: A United Airlines Boeing 777-200 landing at Heathrow International Airport outside London in 2019. A similar United jet entered a sharp dive shortly after leaving Maui on Dec. 18, according to flight data.

results.adx_keywords: Advertising and Marketing;Super Bowl;Religion and Belief
results.title: What is ‘He Gets Us’?
results.abstract: The campaign aims to increase the relevance of Jesus in American culture, according to the agency behind the ads. David Green, the founder of Hobby Lobby, has said he is a donor.

media.caption: A scene from the 30-second Super Bowl ad created by the Servant Foundation for its “He Gets Us” campaign.

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Mercenaries and Private Military Contractors;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Ex-Convicts;Draft and Recruitment (Military);Wagner Group;Bakhmut (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.title: ‘Our Losses Were Gigantic’: Life in a Sacrificial Russian Assault Wave
results.abstract: Poorly trained Russian soldiers captured by Ukraine describe being used as cannon fodder by commanders throwing waves of bodies into an assault.

media.caption: A warden kept watch this month over prisoners of war at a camp in western Ukraine.
media.copyright: Nicole Tung for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO);United States Defense and Military Forces;United States Politics and Government;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Balloons (Aeronautics);North American Aerospace Defense Command;Canada;Alaska;China
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Helene Cooper and Edward Wong
results.title: What’s Going On Up There? Theories but No Answers in Shootdowns of Mystery Craft.
results.abstract: The U.S. and Canada are investigating three unidentified flying objects shot down over North America in the past three days. Militaries have adjusted radars to try to spot more incursions.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The Pentagon and intelligence agencies have intensified their study of unexplained incidents near military bases in recent years.

results.adx_keywords: Football;Super Bowl;Hurts, Jalen (1998- );Mahomes, Patrick (1995- );Kansas City Chiefs;Philadelphia Eagles
results.title: The Eagles Came as Close as Close Can Get
results.abstract: Philadelphia quarterback Jalen Hurts scored four total touchdowns in a performance with only one blemish, but it was a big one: a fumble returned for a touchdown.

media.caption: Kansas City linebacker Nick Bolton stripped the ball from Philadelphia quarterback Jalen Hurts, then picked up the ball and returned it for a touchdown.
media.copyright: AJ Mast for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Super Bowl;Rihanna
results.title: At the Super Bowl, Rihanna Returns to Music, Briefly
results.abstract: After seven years largely away from the stage, the singer and mogul used the halftime show to perform a dozen hits, nod to her nonmusical business and announce that she’s pregnant.

media.caption: Rihanna performing during the halftime show of the Super Bowl, where she sang a dozen songs. A representative revealed that she is pregnant with her second child.

results.adx_keywords: Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Classified Information and State Secrets;Smith, Jack (Attorney);Garland, Merrick B;Trump, Donald J;Justice Department
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
results.title: Jack Smith, Special Counsel for Trump Inquiries, Steps Up the Pace
results.abstract: Named less than three months ago to oversee investigations into Donald J. Trump’s efforts to hold onto power and his handling of classified documents, the special counsel is moving aggressively.

media.caption: Jack Smith has kept a low profile, making no public appearances and sticking to a long pattern of empowering subordinates rather than interposing himself directly in investigations.

results.adx_keywords: Bullies;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Education (K-12);Assaults;Teenagers and Adolescence;Kuch, Adriana;Bayville (NJ);Ocean County (NJ);New Jersey
results.byline: By Michael Rothfeld and Christina Caron
results.title: After Teen’s Suicide, a New Jersey Community Grapples With Bullying
results.abstract: Amid grief and outrage over the death of Adriana Kuch, 14, students have mounted protests, and a schools superintendent has resigned.

media.caption: Adriana Kuch, 14, told her father that she didn’t want to be the girl who was beat up on a video, he said.

results.adx_keywords: Espionage and Intelligence Services;Balloons (Aeronautics);Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO);United States Defense and Military Forces;North American Aerospace Defense Command
results.title: A Timeline of the U.F.O.s That Were Shot Down This Weekend
results.abstract: After a Chinese spy balloon was brought down this month, the U.S. has shot down at least three unidentified flying objects over the past few days.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: After a Chinese spy balloon was shot down on Feb. 4, at least three unidentified objects have been shot down over North America.

results.adx_keywords: Campaign Finance;United States Politics and Government;Ethics and Official Misconduct;internal-sub-only;Santos, George (1988- );Federal Election Commission;House of Representatives;WinRed;New York State
results.byline: By Grace Ashford, Alexandra Berzon, Ken Bensinger and Alyce McFadden
results.title: George Santos and the Case of the Missing $365,000
results.abstract: Representative George Santos’s failure to account for hundreds of thousands of dollars in spending is part of a pattern of irregularities in the way his campaign handled its finances.

media.caption: Among the discrepancies found in Representative George Santos’s campaign filings was an extraordinarily high fee payment to WinRed, a digital platform that processes donations.

results.adx_keywords: Elderly;Population;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Euthanasia and Assisted Suicide;Colleges and Universities;Content Type: Personal Profile;internal-sub-only;Discrimination;Economics (Theory and Philosophy);Narita, Yusuke;Yale University;Japan
results.byline: By Motoko Rich and Hikari Hida
results.title: A Yale Professor Suggested Mass Suicide for Old People in Japan. What Did He Mean?
results.abstract: Yusuke Narita says he is mainly addressing a growing effort to revamp Japan’s age-based hierarchies. Still, he has pushed the country’s hottest button.

media.caption: Yusuke Narita, wearing his signature eyeglasses with one round and one square lens. He said his comments about mass suicide and the elderly had been “taken out of context.”
media.copyright: Bea Oyster for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Balloons (Aeronautics);Airlines and Airplanes;Airships;Military Aircraft;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Beihang University;Communist Party of China;People's Liberation Army (China);China;Dongguan (China);Guangdong Province (China)
results.title: China’s Top Airship Scientist Promoted Program to Watch the World From Above
results.abstract: Corporate records and media reports reveal an airship scientist at the center of China’s high-altitude balloon program. Companies he has founded were among those targeted by Washington.

media.caption: A high-altitude balloon floating over Billings, Mont., earlier this month. It was later shot down off the coast of South Carolina.
media.copyright: Larry Mayer/The Billings Gazette, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Identity Theft;Frauds and Swindling;Rebates and Refunds;Robberies and Thefts;Pierce, Katrina (1971- );Chicago (Ill);Illinois
results.title: Woman Used Identities of Dead People to Defraud U.S., Officials Say
results.abstract: A “lifelong thief and fraudster” from Chicago stole the identities of dozens, including murder victims, and defrauded the government of tax refunds and stimulus money, according to court records.

media.caption: Internal Revenue Service agents seized nearly three dozen death certificates from six states from the woman’s home, according to court documents.

results.adx_keywords: Casinos;Golf;Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Names, Organizational;Trump, Donald J;Trump Organization;Bally Corporation;New York City;Bronx (NYC)
results.byline: By Dana Rubinstein and Stefanos Chen
results.title: Bally’s Casino Proposal May Hinge on Removal of One Word: Trump
results.abstract: With the Trump name mostly anathema in New York, Bally’s is pinning its hopes for a Bronx-based casino on a vow to sever Trump’s name from a golf course there.

media.caption: New York City lost its bid to end a lease that allows the Trump Organization to operate a golf course at Ferry Point in the Bronx.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Rap and Hip-Hop;Deaths (Obituaries);Jolicoeur, David (Trugoy the Dove) (1968-2023);De La Soul
results.title: De La Soul’s David Jolicoeur, Who Rapped as Trugoy the Dove, Dies at 54
results.abstract: The trio expanded the stylistic vocabulary of hip-hop in the 1980s and ’90s, but its early experiments with sampling led to legal troubles, and the group’s longtime exclusion from streaming.

media.caption: David Jolicoeur of De La Soul performing in Mountain View, Calif., in 2019. The group arrived with the album “Three Feet High and Rising” in 1989.

results.adx_keywords: Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Railroad Accidents and Safety;Chemicals;DeWine, Mike;American Red Cross;Environmental Protection Agency;Norfolk Southern Corporation;National Transportation Safety Board;East Palestine (Ohio)
results.title: What We Know About the Train Derailment in Ohio
results.abstract: On Feb. 3, a train derailed in the village of East Palestine, setting off evacuation orders, a toxic chemical scare and a federal investigation.

results.adx_keywords: Earthquakes;Turkey Earthquake (Feb 6, 2023);Building (Construction);Buildings (Structures);Engineering and Engineers;Turkey
results.byline: By James Glanz and Ceylan Yeginsu
results.title: They Were Told Their Building Was Earthquake Safe. It Collapsed Anyway.
results.abstract: Some structures promoted as being built to modern seismic codes did not withstand the quake in Turkey. One upscale tower that fell may have had a design flaw, engineers said.

results.adx_keywords: Interscholastic Athletics;Basketball;National Federation of State High School Assns;Oklahoma
results.title: 4-2 Game Rekindles Shot Clock Debate in High School Basketball
results.abstract: One of the two teams from Oklahoma, the Anadarko High School Warriors, passed the ball around for nearly the entire game in what an announcer called “stall ball.”
org_facet: National Federation of State High School Assns

media.caption: The Anadarko High School Warriors held the ball for most of a game in Weatherford, Okla., last week, almost winning with a three-pointer at the buzzer. Instead they lost 4-2.
